title: 115_s346
content:
The Act is titled the "National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System Act" and defines terms like "Secretary" and "System." The System refers to the National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System established under the Act. The Secretary will establish the National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System within the US Geological Survey to monitor and protect citizens from volcanic activity. The System aims to modernize and unify monitoring systems of volcano observatories in the US. The National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System in the US aims to monitor all volcanoes in the country by upgrading existing networks, installing new ones, and utilizing geodetic components. It includes a national volcano watch office, data center, and grants program for research support. The National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System in the US aims to modernize volcano monitoring with emerging technologies like digital broadband seismometers, GPS receivers, radar interferometry, acoustic sensors, and spectrometry for gas measurements. The Secretary must submit a 5-year management plan to Congress within 180 days of the Act's enactment, including annual cost estimates for modernization. The Secretary must submit annual cost estimates for modernization activities, milestones, standards, and performance goals, as well as recommendations for partnerships. An advisory committee will be established to assist in implementing the System, comprised of representatives from relevant agencies and the scientific community. The Secretary may also enter into cooperative agreements with institutions of higher education and State agencies. The Secretary coordinates activities with relevant Federal agencies, submits an annual report to Congress, and designates institutions of higher education and State agencies as volcano observatory partners for the System. SEC. 4. FUNDING.

Authorization of $55,000,000 for fiscal years 2019 through 2023 to establish the National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System. The funding shall supplement, not supplant, other Federal funds for United States Geological Survey hazards activities.
